forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 47. West northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
The calm before the dawn wraps itself around Downtown San Francisco this early morning, with the crisp air hinting at the coolness that characterizes late March in this vibrant city. The forecast promises a clear overnight, allowing those still awake to take comfort in a tranquil low of 47 degrees. As daylight emerges, expect a mostly sunny canvas stretched across the sky, with the sun’s warmth gently rising towards a modest high of 58. Winds will pick up slightly from the west-northwest, adding a refreshing touch without overwhelming the senses. 

Though for now, the city is enshrouded in stillness, one might sense the allure of a fog-free day ahead filled with expansive blue sky and the silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge proudly standing against the horizon. One could don light layers—a cardigan over a favorite shirt—perfect for those moments when the sun beckons and the breeze whispers through the streets. Engaging in leisurely pursuits seems most fitting; perhaps a stroll through Golden Gate Park, or savoring a quiet coffee at a local haunt while reviewing a book that has patiently awaited attention. The day unfurls with a promise of ease, inviting all to embrace its offerings without the weight of heavy fog to dampen the spirit.
